#Text=Make a Smoker
#Text=Out of Aluminum
#Text=Once summer comes around you want to sit outside with friends and do something fun , like have a barbecue !
#Text=Unfortunately , buying a barbecue smoker could be pretty expensive , so why not make one at home ?
#Text=In this wikiHow , you 'll learn just how to do that !
#Text=Steps
#Text=Get all the materials .
#Text=There 's a list at the bottom of the article under the Things You 'll Need section .
#Text=Luckily , most of these things can be found at your local home improvement retailer !
#Text=If something ca n't be found , then you can probably ask a friend or order it online .
#Text=Prepare the oil drum .
#Text=Make sure that your drum does n't contain anything that could cause a problem , like flammable liquids , for example .
#Text=After you have made sure that your oil drum is safe , you will want to strip the paint off with the angle grinder .
#Text=Make sure you are wearing your eye and face protection at this point !
#Text=If you do n't know how to check for flammable liquids , it is best to speak to a professional and have them make sure your oil drum is safe to work with !
#Text=Create the Chimney for the Smoker
#Text=Cut your steel tubing at a 45-degree angle , and then twist the portion 180 degrees to weld it back on .
#Text=Make sure the weld is all the way around the tubing , so you have a good seal .
#Text=Make a lid .
#Text=Create some dimensions with your measuring tools for the lid now , and mark them with the permanent marker .
#Text=Make sure the oil drum is stable and then use your angle grinder with a cutting disk here to cut along the lines .
#Text=Weld the lid onto the drum
#Text=Weld your strips of steel sheeting onto the oil drum .
#Text=This will add stability and let the lid rest in place when closed .
#Text=Clean the inside of the BBQ

#Text=The main goal for cleaning the inside is not so it can be spotless , but for two reasons : 1 ) If it is not clean of oil the paint will not stick . 2 ) If the oil is there once you start it it will emit thick black smoke .
#Text=Remove the grease by using a de-greaser .
#Text=You can use the same one you use for your oven or you can buy one at any supermarket .
#Text=Fabricate the collapsible frame
#Text=A collapsible frame consists of two rectangles that will fold inside of each other .
#Text=Using a hacksaw , cut a length , you decide the size , and then you will weld the two triangles and make sure they are right angles .
#Text=The second step is to know where the center of each is located and you can drill in holes , size does not matter , and this is where the frames will hinge .
#Text=After you have put the two parts together you will now need to position the frame correctly so the oil drum can be on top of it .
#Text=An obstacle you might run into is preventing the frame from falling , so you may have to use a string to keep the pieces together .
#Text=Then when you are done the frame will close .
#Text=Attach hinges to the lid
#Text=You will need nuts and bolts for this step .
#Text=For this step , you will need to place your hinges correctly and to do that you should use a permanent pen to mark the spots of the hinges .
#Text=Add the safety edging
#Text=You will need to add the safety edging in sharp areas of the lid and oil drum .
#Text=A tip is to do it on the inside so it can also hide the welds .
#Text=Attach the handle
#Text=You will need a handle fabricated from steel .
#Text=Weld the handle in the middle of the lid .
#Text=Make sure to remove all the little pieces of metal created from cutting the steel .
#Text=Add the grill supports and hooks
#Text=Weld two bars of steel for the main grill and other two for the smoker grill , with all of them going through the extension of the oil drum .
#Text=At the bars ' tips of the main grill , weld another piece of steel to form a hook on both sides .
#Text=When placing the bar , be certain that the holes from left side to right side are aligned .
#Text=Weld 3 small hooks on one side of the drum to form holders for BBQ`s tools .

#Text=Drill a hole in the lid for temperature dial , drill two large holes on each side of the oil drum for ventilation , and several small ones in the middle of the drum ( on the bottom ) for drainage .
#Text=Create the grill .
#Text=Weld the steel mesh with the safety edgings .
#Text=Make sure the material of your mesh is stainless steel in order to avoid bits of rust in your food .
#Text=Finish the smoker .
#Text=Now you have successfully made the grill !
#Text=Warnings
#Text=Some quick safety tips when welding are :
#Text=Always wear proper face sheilds .
#Text=Always close-toed shoes .
#Text=Always wear a long-sleeved , non-flammable shirt .
#Text=Always wear proper welding gloves .
#Text=Always wear proper ear protection ( to prevent sparks from entering your ear canal ) .
#Text=NEVER weld near an area that was cleaned with chlorinated hydrocarbon like brake-cleaner .
#Text=When combined with UV light and chlorinated hydrocarbon it creates a toxic gas that can cause sever injuries or death .
#Text=When buying your oil drum you must decontaminate the drum .
#Text=You can sanitize your oil drum by following these simple steps :
#Text=Empty as much material out of the drum as possible .
#Text=Add absorbents or adsorbents bentonite , kitty litter to take up any free oil left in the drum .
#Text=Things You 'll Need
#Text=An MIG Welder and some wire
#Text=An angle grinder , along with some cutting disks , sanding disks , and grinding disks
#Text=Hammer
#Text=Hacksaw
#Text=Engineer 's square
#Text=Ruler
#Text=Tape measure
#Text=Permanent pen
#Text=Drill
#Text=Some drill bits
#Text=Center punch tool
#Text=Oil drum
#Text=High-temperature barbecue paint
#Text=Steel hinges
#Text=Chrome coach hook
#Text=Barbecue temperature dial
#Text=Mild Steel box section
#Text=6 millimeter Mild Steel round bar
#Text=U section safety edging
#Text=Strips of steel sheet
#Text=Stainless steel grill or stainless steel mesh
#Text=Nuts and bolts for the hinges and frame
#Text=Large Steel tubing for the chimney
#Text=Safety protection ( optional , examples are gloves , a face mask , and goggles )
